1.1e.description: Translate evidence from nursing science as well as other sciences into practice.

1.1f.description: Demonstrate the application of nursing science to practice.

1.1g.description: Integrate an understanding of nursing history in advancing nursing’s influence in health care.

1.2f.description: Synthesize knowledge from nursing and other disciplines to inform education, practice, and research.

1.2g.description: Apply a systematic and defendable approach to nursing practice decisions.

1.2h.description: Employ ethical decision making to assess, intervene, and evaluate nursing care.

1.2j.description: Translate theories from nursing and other disciplines to practice.

1.3d.description: Integrate foundational and advanced specialty knowledge into clinical reasoning.

1.3e.description: Synthesize current and emerging evidence to Influence practice.

1.3f.description: Analyze decision models from nursing and other knowledge domains to improve clinical judgment.

2.1d.description: Promote caring relationships to effect positive outcomes.

2.2g.description: Demonstrate advanced communication skills and techniques using a variety of modalities with diverse audiences.

2.2i.description: Apply individualized information, such as genetic/genomic, pharmacogenetic, and environmental exposure information in the delivery of personalized health care.

2.2j.description: Facilitate difficult conversations and disclosure of sensitive information.

2.3h.description: Demonstrate that one’s practice is informed by a comprehensive assessment appropriate to the functional area of advanced nursing practice.

2.4f.description: Employ context driven, advanced reasoning to the diagnostic and decision-making process.

2.4g.description: Integrate advanced scientific knowledge to guide decision making.

2.5h.description: Lead and collaborate with an interprofessional team to develop a comprehensive plan of care.

2.5i.description: Prioritize risk mitigation strategies to prevent or reduce adverse outcomes.

2.5j.description: Develop evidence-based interventions to improve outcomes and safety.

2.5k.description: Incorporate innovations into practice when evidence is not available.

2.6e.description: Model best care practices to the team.

2.6f.description: Monitor aggregate metrics to assure accountability for care outcomes.

2.6g.description: Promote delivery of care that supports practice at the full scope of education.

2.6h.description: Contribute to the development of policies and processes that promote transparency and accountability.

2.6i.description: Apply current and emerging evidence to the development of care guidelines/tools.

2.6j.description: Ensure accountability throughout transitions of care across the health continuum.

2.7d.description: Analyze data to identify gaps and inequities in care and monitor trends in outcomes.

2.7e.description: Monitor epidemiological and system-level aggregate data to determine healthcare outcomes and trends.

2.7f.description: Synthesize outcome data to inform evidencebased practice, guidelines, and policies.

2.8f.description: Develop strategies that promote self-care management.

2.8g.description: Incorporate the use of current and emerging technologies to support self-care management.

2.8h.description: Employ counseling techniques, including motivational interviewing, to advance wellness and self-care management.

2.8i.description: Evaluate adequacy of resources available to support self-care management.

2.8j.description: Foster partnerships with community organizations to support self-care management.

2.9e.description: Provide coordination of care of individuals and families in collaboration with care team.

2.9f.description: Evaluate communication pathways among providers and others across settings, systems, and communities.

2.9g.description: Develop strategies to optimize care coordination and transitions of care.

2.9h.description: Guide the coordination of care across health systems.

2.9i.description: Analyze system-level and public policy influence on care coordination.

2.9j.description: Participate in system-level change to improve care coordination across settings.

3.1j.description: Assess the efficacy of a system’s capability to serve a target sub-population’s healthcare needs.

3.1k.description: Analyze primary and secondary population health data for multiple populations against relevant benchmarks.

3.1l.description: Use established or evolving methods to determine population-focused priorities for care.

3.1m.description: Develop a collaborative approach with relevant stakeholders to address population healthcare needs, including evaluation methods.

3.1n.description: Collaborate with appropriate stakeholders to implement a sociocultural and linguistically responsive intervention plan.

3.2d.description: Ascertain collaborative opportunities for individuals and organizations to improve population health.

3.2e.description: Challenge biases and barriers that impact population health outcomes.

3.2f.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of partnerships for achieving health equity.

3.2g.description: Lead partnerships to improve population health outcomes.

3.2h.description: Assess preparation and readiness of partners to organize during natural and manmade disasters.

3.3c.description: Analyze cost-benefits of selected populationbased interventions.

3.3d.description: Collaborate with partners to secure and leverage resources necessary for effective, sustainable interventions.

3.3e.description: Advocate for interventions that maximize costeffective, accessible, and equitable resources for populations.

3.3f.description: Incorporate ethical principles in resource allocation in achieving equitable health.

3.4f.description: Identify opportunities to influence the policy process.

3.4g.description: Design comprehensive advocacy strategies to support the policy process.

3.4h.description: Engage in strategies to influence policy change.

3.4i.description: Contribute to policy development at the system, local, regional, or national levels.

3.4j.description: Assess the impact of policy changes.

3.4k.description: Evaluate the ability of policy to address disparities and inequities within segments of the population.

3.4l.description: Evaluate the risks to population health associated with globalization.

3.5f.description: Appraise advocacy priorities for a population.

3.5g.description: Strategize with an interdisciplinary group and others to develop effective advocacy approaches.

3.5h.description: Engage in relationship-building activities with stakeholders at any level of influence, including system, local, state, national, and/or global.

3.5i.description: Demonstrate leadership skills to promote advocacy efforts that include principles of social justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion.

3.6f.description: Collaboratively initiate rapid response activities to protect population health.

3.6g.description: Participate in ethical decision making that includes diversity, equity, and inclusion in advanced preparedness to protect populations.

3.6h.description: Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to lead preparedness and mitigation efforts to protect population health with attention to the most vulnerable populations.

3.6i.description: Coordinate the implementation of evidencebased infection control measures and proper use of personal protective equipment.

3.6j.description: Contribute to system-level planning, decision making, and evaluation for disasters and public health emergencies.

4.1h.description: Apply and critically evaluate advanced knowledge in a defined area of nursing practice.

4.1i.description: Engage in scholarship to advance health.

4.1j.description: Discern appropriate applications of quality improvement, research, and evaluation methodologies.

4.1l.description: Disseminate one’s scholarship to diverse audiences using a variety of approaches or modalities.

4.1m.description: Advocate within the interprofessional team and with other stakeholders for the contributions of nursing scholarship.

4.2f.description: Use diverse sources of evidence to inform practice.

4.2g.description: Lead the translation of evidence into practice.

4.2h.description: Address opportunities for innovation and changes in practice.

4.2i.description: Collaborate in the development of new/revised policy or regulation in the light of new evidence.

4.2j.description: Articulate inconsistencies between practice policies and best evidence.

4.2k.description: Evaluate outcomes and impact of new practices based on the evidence.

4.3e.description: Identify and mitigate potential risks and areas of ethical concern in the conduct of scholarly activities.

4.3f.description: Apply IRB guidelines throughout the scholarship process.

4.3g.description: Ensure the protection of participants in the conduct of scholarship.

4.3h.description: Implement processes that support ethical conduct in practice and scholarship.

4.3i.description: Apply ethical principles to the dissemination of nursing scholarship.

5.1i.description: Establish and incorporate data driven benchmarks to monitor system performance.

5.1j.description: Use national safety resources to lead teambased change initiatives.

5.1k.description: Integrate outcome metrics to inform change and policy recommendations.

5.1l.description: Collaborate in analyzing organizational process improvement initiatives.

5.1m.description: Lead the development of a business plan for quality improvement initiatives.

5.1n.description: Advocate for change related to financial policies that impact the relationship between economics and quality care delivery.

5.1o.description: Advance quality improvement practices through dissemination of outcomes.

5.2g.description: Evaluate the alignment of system data and comparative patient safety benchmarks.

5.2h.description: Lead analysis of actual errors, near misses, and potential situations that would impact safety.

5.2i.description: Design evidence-based interventions to mitigate risk.

5.2j.description: Evaluate emergency preparedness system-level plans to protect safety.

5.3e.description: Advocate for structures, policies, and processes that promote a culture of safety and prevent workplace risks and injury.

5.3f.description: Foster a just culture reflecting civility and respect.

5.3g.description: Create a safe and transparent culture for reporting incidents.

5.3h.description: Role model and lead well-being and resiliency for self and team.

6.1g.description: Evaluate effectiveness of interprofessional communication tools and techniques to support and improve the efficacy of team-based interactions.

6.1h.description: Facilitate improvements in interprofessional communications of individual information (e.g. EHR).

6.1i.description: Role model respect for diversity, equity, and inclusion in team-based communications.

6.1j.description: Communicate nursing’s unique disciplinary knowledge to strengthen interprofessional partnerships.

6.1k.description: Provide expert consultation for other members of the healthcare team in one’s area of practice.

6.1l.description: Demonstrate capacity to resolve interprofessional conflict.

6.2g.description: Integrate evidence-based strategies and processes to improve team effectiveness and outcomes.

6.2h.description: Evaluate the impact of team dynamics and performance on desired outcomes.

6.2i.description: Reflect on how one’s role and expertise influences team performance.

6.2j.description: Foster positive team dynamics to strengthen desired outcomes.

6.4e.description: Practice self-assessment to mitigate conscious and implicit biases toward other team members.

6.4f.description: Foster an environment that supports the constructive sharing of multiple perspectives and enhances interprofessional learning.

6.4g.description: Integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion into team practices.

6.4h.description: Manage disagreements, conflicts, and challenging conversations among team members.

6.4i.description: Promote an environment that advances interprofessional learning.

7.1f.description: Participate in system-wide initiatives that improve care delivery and/or outcomes.

7.1g.description: Analyze system-wide processes to optimize outcomes.

7.1h.description: Design policies to impact health equity and structural racism within systems, communities, and populations.

7.2g.description: Analyze relevant internal and external factors that drive healthcare costs and reimbursement.

7.2h.description: Design practices that enhance value, access, quality, and cost-effectiveness.

7.2i.description: Advocate for healthcare economic policies and regulations to enhance value, quality, and costeffectiveness.

7.2j.description: Formulate, document, and disseminate the return on investment for improvement initiatives collaboratively with an interdisciplinary team.

7.2k.description: Recommend system-wide strategies that improve cost- effectiveness considering structure, leadership, and workforce needs.

7.2l.description: Evaluate health policies based on an ethical framework considering cost-effectiveness, health equity, and care outcomes.

7.3e.description: Apply innovative and evidence-based strategies focusing on system preparedness and capabilities.

7.3f.description: Design system improvement strategies based on performance data and metrics.

7.3g.description: Manage change to sustain system effectiveness.

7.3h.description: Design system improvement strategies that address internal and external system processes and structures that perpetuate structural racism and other forms of discrimination in healthcare systems.

8.1g.description: Identify best evidence and practices for the application of information and communication technologies to support care.

8.1h.description: Evaluate the unintended consequences of information and communication technologies on care processes, communications, and information flow across care settings.

8.1i.description: Propose a plan to influence the selection and implementation of new information and communication technologies.

8.1j.description: Explore the fiscal impact of information and communication technologies on health care.

8.1k.description: Identify the impact of information and communication technologies on workflow processes and healthcare outcomes.

8.2f.description: Generate information and knowledge from health information technology databases.

8.2g.description: Evaluate the use of communication technology to improve consumer health information literacy.

8.2h.description: Use standardized data to evaluate decisionmaking and outcomes across all systems levels.

8.2i.description: Clarify how the collection of standardized data advances the practice, understanding, and value of nursing and supports care.

8.2j.description: Interpret primary and secondary data and other information to support care.

8.3g.description: Evaluate the use of information and communication technology to address needs, gaps, and inefficiencies in care.

8.3h.description: Formulate a plan to influence decisionmaking processes for selecting, implementing, and evaluating support tools.

8.3i.description: Appraise the role of information and communication technologies in engaging the patient and supporting the nurse-patient relationship.

8.3j.description: Evaluate the potential uses and impact

8.3k.description: Pose strategies to reduce inequities in digital access to data and information.

8.4e.description: Assess best practices for the use of advanced information and communication technologies to support patient and team communications.

8.4f.description: Employ electronic health, mobile health, and telehealth systems to enable quality, ethical, and efficient patient care.

8.4g.description: Evaluate the impact of health information exchange, interoperability, and integration to support patient-centered care.

8.5g.description: Apply risk mitigation and security strategies to reduce misuse of information and communication technology.

8.5h.description: Assess potential ethical and legal issues associated with the use of information and communication technology.

8.5i.description: Recommend strategies to protect health information when using communication and information technology.

8.5j.description: Promote patient engagement with their personal health data.

8.5k.description: Advocate for policies and regulations that support the appropriate use of technologies impacting health care.

8.5l.description: Analyze the impact of federal and state policies and regulation on health data and technology in care settings.

9.1h.description: Analyze current policies and practices in the context of an ethical framework.

9.1i.description: Model ethical behaviors in practice and leadership roles.

9.1j.description: Suggest solutions when unethical behaviors are observed.

9.1k.description: Assume accountability for working to resolve ethical dilemmas.

9.2h.description: Foster opportunities for intentional presence in practice.

9.2i.description: Identify innovative and evidence-based practices that promote person-centered care.

9.2j.description: Advocate for practices that advance diversity, equity, and inclusion.

9.2k.description: Model professional expectations for therapeutic relationships.

9.2l.description: Facilitate communication that promotes a participatory approach.

9.3i.description: Advocate for nursing’s professional responsibility for ensuring optimal care outcomes

9.3j.description: Demonstrate leadership skills when participating in professional activities and/or organizations.

9.3k.description: Address actual or potential hazards and/or errors.

9.3l.description: Foster a practice environment that promotes accountability for care outcomes.

9.3m.description: Advocate for policies/practices that promote social justice and health equity.

9.3n.description: Foster strategies that promote a culture of civility across a variety of settings.

9.3o.description: Lead in the development of opportunities for professional and interprofessional activities.

9.4d.description: Advocate for polices that enable nurses to practice to the full extent of their education.

9.4e.description: Assess the interaction between regulatory agency requirements and quality, fiscal, and value-based indicators.

9.4f.description: Evaluate the effect of legal and regulatory policies on nursing practice and healthcare outcomes.

9.4g.description: Analyze efforts to change legal and regulatory policies that improve nursing practice and health outcomes.

9.4h.description: Participate in the implementation of policies and regulations to improve the professional practice environment and healthcare outcomes.

9.5f.description: Articulate nursing’s unique professional identity to other interprofessional team members and the public.

9.5g.description: Evaluate practice environment to ensure that nursing core values are demonstrated.

9.5h.description: Identify opportunities to lead with moral courage to influence team decision-making.

9.5i.description: Engage in professional organizations that reflect nursing’s values and identity.

9.6d.description: Model respect for diversity, equity, and inclusion for all team members.

9.6e.description: Critique one’s personal and professional practices in the context of nursing’s core values.

9.6f.description: Analyze the impact of structural and cultural influences on nursing’s professional identity

9.6g.description: Ensure that care provided by self and others is reflective of nursing’s core values.

9.6h.description: Structure the practice environment to facilitate care that is culturally and linguistically appropriate.

9.6i.description: Ensure self and others are accountable in upholding moral, legal, and humanistic principles related to health.

10.1c.description: Contribute to an environment that promotes self-care, personal health, and well-being.

10.1d.description: Evaluate the workplace environment to determine level of health and well-being.

10.2f.description: Identify role models and mentors to support professional growth.

10.2g.description: Demonstrate cognitive flexibility in managing change within complex environments.

10.2h.description: Mentor others in the development of their professional growth and accountability

10.2i.description: Foster activities that support a culture of lifelong learning.

10.2j.description: Expand leadership skills through professional service.

10.3j.description: Provide leadership to advance the nursing profession.

10.3k.description: k Influence intentional change guided by leadership principles and theories.

10.3l.description: Evaluate the outcomes of intentional change.

10.3n.description: Participate in the evaluation of other members of the care team.

10.3o.description: Demonstrate leadership skills in times of uncertainty and crisis.

10.3p.description: Advocate for the promotion of social justice and eradication of structural racism and systematic inequity in nursing and society.

10.3q.description: Advocate for the nursing profession in a manner that is consistent, positive, relevant, accurate, and distinctive.
